title: Efficient Speech Enhancement via Embeddings from Pre-trained Generative Audioencoders
author: Xingwei Sun (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Heinrich Dinkel (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Yadong Niu (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Linzhang Wang (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Junbo Zhang (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.), Jian Luan (MiLM Plus, Xiaomi Inc.)
relevance_why: The use of generative audioencoders for speech enhancement aligns well with Haohe Liu's work on audio processing, particularly in improving the quality of speech signals. Techniques for denoising and utilizing pre-trained models could enhance his own research in audio quality restoration.
background: The task addresses the challenge of enhancing speech quality by removing noise from speech signals using advanced audio embeddings extracted from pre-trained models.
contribution: This paper introduces an efficient speech enhancement method utilizing embeddings from pre-trained generative audioencoders to improve the quality and intelligibility of noisy speech signals.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on time-frequency masking or signal prediction techniques, which may not adapt well to varying noise conditions.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon earlier approaches by leveraging a compact denoising encoder and a neural vocoder that synthesizes clean speech from embeddings while keeping pre-trained models frozen, thus reducing the need for extensive retraining.

key_innovation: The integration of a denoise encoder that operates efficiently on embeddings extracted from frozen pre-trained models distinguishes this method, allowing for flexibility in tackling various audio processing tasks.
real_world_impact: The proposed system has the potential to significantly enhance voice quality in applications like telecommunications and assistive listening devices, addressing common issues in real-world communication scenarios.
limitations: No limitation was explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.audioencoder: **Audioencoder** refers to a model designed to encode audio signals into embeddings, capturing essential features necessary for tasks like speech enhancement.
new_terms.denoise encoder: **Denoise encoder** is a neural network that specifically processes noisy speech embeddings to remove unwanted noise and enhance speech quality.
new_terms.vocoder: **Vocoder** is a synthesizing technique that converts embeddings or features back into audible speech waveforms, often utilizing generative models.

open_sourcing: The authors have mentioned open-sourcing their inference code along with pre-trained checkpoints and audio demonstrations.
